details.purpose: To record general administrative information required to discharge a patient

items.items: The administrative information required at the time of discharge of a patient from a period of care
The date of discharge for this care episode
The destination of a patient on completion of a hospital provder spell
Usual place of residence, includes patients with no fixed abode
Includes patients with no fixed abode
Repatriation from high security psychiatric accommodation
NHS other - high security psychiatric accommodation
NHS other - general ward/younger physically disabled ward
NHS other - maternity patients or neonates
Local authority residential accommodation, care provided
Not applicable - patient died or still birth
An outline of the decision to discharge the patient (if applicable)
The department or specialty with responsibility for the patient at the time of discharge
The name of the consultant responsible for care of the patient at the time of discharge
The ward from which the patient was discharged
The organisation with responsibility for the patient at the time of discharge
The details of the destination of the patient on discharge
The details of the organisation to which the patient is to be discharged if not the usual place of residence
Was the discharge delayed for any reason
Discharge procedure discussed and agreed with Parent/Carer
Discharge procedure discussed and agreed with Parent/Carer?
Date patient/carer informed of Planned Discharge
